title: "What is the connection between esoteric Taoism and exceptional abilities in shamanism and magic? A study of initiations and spiritual experiences."
first_phrase: In the final section of the text, "Piú avanti," in Chapter XII, page 386, the author references an esoteric Taoist text. The section details accounts of individuals who obtained initiation through the assumption of the Wàivúwen, a force believed to have been incarnated in a deceased initiate. This force allows individuals to possess exceptional powers, such as the Yatiategn, an active vision faculty. The text draws a connection between these accounts and the technique of visualizations used in various magical operations, ultimately leading to a discussion of the dual nature of man.

Questi due uomini corrispondono a due stati che si alternano, come attività radiante e ombra, passività ri cettiva.
last_phrase: In conclusion, recognizing the duality within ourselves, the outer and inner person, and their relationship with the sun and the moon can provide valuable insights into our consciousness and the symbolism of ancient texts. Practicing exercises like ascending and descending a mountain during sunset and sunrise can offer powerful experiences and increase our understanding of the techniques of visualization often used in various magical operations.
